items.title: Wall St finishes down after sell-off at end of strong holiday-shortened week
items.description: The Dow fell 333.59 points, or 0.77%, to 42,992.21. The S&P 500 lost 66.75 points, or 1.11%, to finish at 5,970.84 points, while the Nasdaq Composite dropped 298.33 points, or 1.49%, to end at 19,722.03.

items.title: Market bounce back, up 1% led by auto, pharma; rupee at fresh low
items.description: The Indian rupee depreciated sharply and recorded fresh record low of 85.81 on Friday, which was the worst single-day fall for Rupee since June 4, weighed down a strong month-end demand for dollar in the non-deliverable forwards (NDF) market.

items.title: These smallcaps gain between 10-25% despite broader indices underperform
items.description: For the month till now, FIIs sold equities worth Rs 10,444.10 crore, while DIIs purchased equities worth Rs 27,474.14 crore.
